subject: Productivity
title: The Zeigarnik Effect
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Zeigarnik Effect.

hook.text: A Russian psychologist noticed that waiters remembered open orders perfectly â€” but forgot closed ones.

buildup.text: Bluma Zeigarnik discovered that the brain obsesses over unfinished tasks. Incomplete loops nag.

discovery.text: This effect means starting a task, even briefly, creates mental tension that pulls you back to it.

twist.text: Procrastinators can use this as a weapon. Start for just two minutes and the brain wants to continue.

climax.text: The hardest part isn't doing the work. It's starting. The Zeigarnik effect handles the rest.

punchline.text: Start for two minutes. Your brain will finish.

quiz.question: What is the Zeigarnik Effect?
options: The brain obsesses over unfinished tasks
The brain forgets all tasks immediately
Completed tasks create the most mental tension
